question: At 5 PM, a driver of a motorcycle (excluding personal mobility devices) drove without stopping in a protection area for older persons. Which of the following is the correct amount of fine imposed upon the driver according to the Road Traffic Act?
answer1: ① KRW 100,000 – 40 points
answer2: ② KRW 80,000 – 30 points
answer3: ③ KRW 60,000 – 15 points
answer4: ④ KRW 40,000 – 10 points

question: According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is NOT a specially designated zone?
answer1: ① School Zone
answer2: ② Protection area for older persons
answer3: ③ Protection area persons with disabilities
answer4: ④ Youth Protection Zone

question: A motorcyclist fails to drive cautiously in a protection area for older persons and causes injury to a senior citizen, who requires two weeks of medical treatment. What happens to the driver?
answer1: ① The driver will not be punished if he/she has a comprehensive insurance policy.
answer2: ② The driver will be criminally charged, regardless of the circumstances.
answer3: ③ The driver is required to reach a settlement with the victim to avoid punishment.
answer4: ④ The driver will not be punished if he/she has a driver's insurance policy only.

question: At 3:00 p.m., a two-wheeled vehicle used for delivery purposes drives at 51 kilometers per hour in a protection area for older persons where the speed limit is 30 kilometers per hour. What is the fine imposed on the employer?
answer2: ② KRW 90,000
answer3: ③ KRW 70,000
answer4: ④ KRW 50,000

question: A motorcyclist belatedly notices a senior citizen crossing a crosswalk without traffic lights for pedestrians, and stops immediately, but still causes an accident, resulting in 2 weeks of medical treatment for the senior citizen. Which of the following statements is correct?
answer1: ① The driver is not at fault as there were no traffic lights for pedestrians.
answer2: ② The driver is subject to civil and criminal liabilities.
answer3: ③ Only the senior citizen who crossed the road will be criminally charged.
answer4: ④ The driver will not be criminally liable if he/she has a comprehensive insurance policy.

question: A motor vehicle is turning right at an intersection that has traffic lights, but no signals to assist motor vehicles. Which of the following is a case of violation of the Road Traffic Act?
answer1: ① A driver turning right without interfering the traffic of other vehicles and horses when the traffic light is red.
answer2: ② Turning right without stopping before the stop line when the traffic light is green.
answer3: ③ When the traffic light is yellow, a vehicle turning right should not interfere with the crossing of a pedestrian.
answer4: ④ Stopping and turning right if the vehicle does not interfere with traffic of other vehicles regardless of the traffic light.

question: Which of the following statements about turning right at an intersection with no traffic lights is correct?
answer1: ① Turn right as fast as possible.
answer2: ② Wait until the vehicles entering the intersection ahead of you pass by, and then take the right turn.
answer3: ③ When a vehicle coming in the opposite direction is taking a left turn, turn right at the same time, with caution.
answer4: ④ You don’t need to worry about other vehicles when you turn right from a wide road onto a narrow one.

question: Which of the following is the safest method to drive when making a right turn at an intersection?
answer1: ① Switch on the turn signal as you approach the intersection.
answer2: ② If there is a solid white line, take the right turn with caution.
answer3: ③ Turn right while making sure not to obstruct vehicles coming from the left.
answer4: ④ Turn right quickly while checking for other vehicles.

question: Which of the following is the correct method to make a left/right turn at an intersection?
answer1: ① When making a right turn, quickly pass through the intersection while carefully checking for pedestrians and bicycles that must stop or proceed according to the signal.
answer2: ② When making a left turn, pass through the outside of the intersection's center.
answer3: ③ When making a right turn, reduce the speed in advance while driving along the right edge of the road.
answer4: ④ When making a left turn at an intersection without traffic signals while a pedestrian is crossing the road, quickly pass in front of the pedestrian.

question: What is the correct method to make a left turn at an intersection without any traffic control?
answer1: ① On general roadways, use the turn signal immediately before the intersection and turn left.
answer2: ② Slow down and follow the center line of the road, and turn left by going around the central island on the outer lane of the intersection.
answer3: ③ You cannot turn left from the outer lane of an intersection, even if it is permitted by the commissioner of City/Do police agency.
answer4: ④ You must slow down. You may or may not stop as you enter, at your discretion.

question: Which of the following is the safest method to drive when trying to enter and turn left at an intersection that is not in traffic control?
answer1: ① Even if there are other vehicles that have entered the intersection already, proceed slowly and turn left carefully.
answer2: ② Yield to vehicles that are on the broad road.
answer3: ③ You must yield to a vehicle going straight, but you do not have to yield to a vehicle turning right.
answer4: ④ Go slowly along the road's center line beforehand and make a left turn using the outside center of the intersection.

question: Which one of the following is not a safe method to drive through a roundabout?
answer1: ① Slow down before entering a roundabout.
answer2: ② Stop at the yield line and enter slowly.
answer3: ③ As a vehicle entering the roundabout has the right of way, the vehicle already in the roundabout must yield.
answer4: ④ Drive in an anti-clockwise direction.

question: Which of the following is the correct method of passing through an intersection?
answer1: ① If the red light is blinking, drive slowly.
answer2: ② When the yellow traffic light is flashing, drive through the intersection as quickly as you can.
answer3: ③ Do not pass ahead of other vehicles at the intersection.
answer4: ④ When you approach the intersection, always use your high-beam headlights.

question: Which of the following indicates the correct method to drive through an intersection?
answer1: ① When entering an intersection, proceed by shortening your distance from the car in front of you.
answer2: ② When entering an intersection, proceed slowly while honking your horn.
answer3: ③ If the intersection is congested, stop immediately before the stop line, even at a green signal.
answer4: ④ If the signal at the traffic light conflicts with the instruction given by a police officer, follow the traffic light.

question: Which of the following describes the most correct method of driving through an intersection where there is no traffic control?
answer1: ① Drive slowly when it is not possible to check the left and right sides of the intersection.
answer2: ② A motor vehicle that intends to turn left is given priority over a motor vehicle going straight.
answer3: ③ A motor vehicle that intends to turn right must go before a motor vehicle going straight.
answer4: ④ A motor vehicle coming from a road that is narrower than the other road that it crosses must drive slowly.

question: Which of the following statements describes the most appropriate way to make a left turn at an intersection?
answer1: ① Drive slowly along the center line, and make a left turn using the inner side of the intersection center.
answer2: ② Drive at high speed along the center line, and take a left turn using the inner side of the intersection center.
answer3: ③ Drive at high speed along the center line, and make a left turn using the outer side of the intersection center.
answer4: ④ Drive slowly along the center line, and make a left turn in a way that is comfortable for the driver.

question: You are stopped at a red light, and a bicycle is ahead of you. How should you safely resume driving when the light turns green?
answer1: ① Start moving before the bicycle does.
answer2: ② Allow the bicycle enough time and distance to move ahead.
answer3: ③ Move closer to the bicycle.
answer4: ④ Drive fast, honking your horn, so that you can pass the cyclist.

question: The driver of a two-wheeled vehicle stopped over the stop line at an intersection when the light turned red. Which one of the following traffic infringements has he just committed?
answer1: ① Illegal turn
answer2: ② Illegal lane change
answer3: ③ Illegal violation of a thoroughfare in an intersection
answer4: ④ Signal violation

question: The driver of a two-wheeled vehicle is about to turn left at an intersection. Which of the following describes the best method?
answer1: ① The motorcyclist stays on the motorcycle and crosses the crosswalk.
answer2: ② The motorcyclist starts by driving toward the right side of the road and then slowly takes a left turn along the edge of the intersection.
answer3: ③ The motorcyclist slows down along the road's median strip and turns left around the inner side of the intersection.
answer4: ④ The motorcyclist can make the left turn from any lane.

question: According to the Road Traffic Act and its Enforcement Decree, which of the following guides drivers to the correct lane and direction at an intersection?
answer1: ① Center line
answer2: ② Turn line
answer3: ③ Regulatory line
answer4: ④ Instruction line

question: According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is NOT prohibited at an intersection?
answer1: ① Overtaking
answer2: ② Parking
answer3: ③ Stopping
answer4: ④ Slowing down

question: Which of the following describes the safest method for a motorcyclist to drive through a roundabout?
answer1: ① Stop momentarily before entering the roundabout, and enter when there is no car approaching from the left.
answer2: ② Turn clockwise in the roundabout.
answer3: ③ Cross the traffic island to drive through the roundabout.
answer4: ④ Once in the roundabout, cut in front of other cars frequently.

question: A two-wheeled vehicle is trying to make a right turn following a truck at an intersection with a bicycle-only lane. Which of the following is the safest way to approach for the two-wheeled vehicle?
answer1: ① Stop and confirm safety first, then quickly make the right turn.
answer2: ② Check both sides and the rear and make the right turn while staying alert on potential blind spots.
answer3: ③ Stay on the right side of the truck and make the turn with the truck while keeping sufficient space.
answer4: ④ Change lanes onto the bicycle-only lane and make the right turn.

question: Which of the following is not an exclusive lane under the Road Traffic Act?
answer1: ① Bus-only lane
answer2: ② Multi-passenger vehicle-only lane
answer3: ③ Two-wheeled vehicle-only lane
answer4: ④ Bicycle-only lane

question: According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following occurs when the driver of a two-wheeled vehicle uses a bicycle-only lane? (There is no sign prohibiting two-wheeled vehicles)
answer1: ① The driver is given an infringement notice with a fine of KRW 40,000.
answer2: ② The driver is given an infringement notice with a fine of KRW 30,000.
answer3: ③ The driver is fined KRW 20,000.
answer4: ④ The driver is not punished.

question: At a green light, a motorcycle squeezes into a congested intersection but ends up queuing across the intersection, interfering with the traffic. What traffic rule does this behavior violate?
answer1: ① Proper way to cut in
answer2: ② Proper way to pass through an intersection
answer3: ③ Proper way to change lanes
answer4: ④ Traffic signal

question: Before entering an intersection, the traffic light changes to yellow. Which of the following is the safest driving method?
answer1: ① Accelerate and enter the intersection quickly.
answer2: ② Stop immediately before the stop line.
answer3: ③ Change into an empty lane and continue driving.
answer4: ④ As cars could be coming from other directions, sound the horn and continue driving.

question: After entering an intersection, the traffic light changes to yellow. Which of the following is the safest driving course of action?
answer1: ① If the vehicle ahead stops, change lanes to the left and continue driving.
answer2: ② Stop immediately at the intersection.
answer3: ③ Quickly finish driving through the intersection.
answer4: ④ Use the horn to caution any bicycle ahead to stay out of the way.

question: Which of the following statements describes the correct method to pass through an intersection where the red light is flashing?
answer1: ① Slow down and continue driving.
answer2: ② Stop momentarily before entering the intersection, check for safety, and continue driving.
answer3: ③ Continue driving.
answer4: ④ Sound the horn and drive quickly through the intersection.

question: Which of the following statements about traffic signals is correct?
answer1: ① When the yellow light is flashing– all vehicles must stop before the stop line and not continue further.
answer2: ② Red light
answer3: ③ Green arrow
answer4: ④ Yellow light

question: Which of the following is the safest method to drive when entering an intersection with signals?
answer1: ① Enter quickly by increasing speed.
answer2: ② Enter while maintaining your distance from the car in front.
answer3: ③ Enter by narrowing your distance from the car in front.
answer4: ④ Enter while paying attention to the car that is following you.

question: According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following people is NOT subject to the obligation to follow traffic signals or instructions?
answer1: ① A pedestrian crossing at a crosswalk with a streetlight
answer2: ② The driver of a cultivator driving on the road
answer3: ③ A farmer riding on a horse carriage on an unpaved road
answer4: ④ A passenger next to the driver's seat in a motor vehicle operating on a road

question: According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is a space where a motor vehicle can stop?
answer1: ① 7 meters away from safety zones
answer2: ② 7 meters away from bus stations
answer3: ③ 7 meters away from corners of streets
answer4: ④ 7 meters away from a crosswalk

question: Which of the following statements about bicycle traffic is incorrect?
answer1: ① Bicycles are classified as vehicles.
answer2: ② In principle, you cannot ride a bicycle on pedestrian walks.
answer3: ③ Cyclists must dismount and push their bicycles when crossing a crosswalk.
answer4: ④ Cyclists are allowed to ignore traffic signals at intersections.

question: Which of the following is the correct action to take when the brake light of a car in front is turned on?
answer1: ① Honk the horn.
answer2: ② Slow down.
answer3: ③ Change lanes.
answer4: ④ Overtake.

question: Which of the following is an area where you must drive slowly according to the Road Traffic Act?
answer1: ① An intersection with traffic control
answer2: ② A curved section of a road
answer3: ③ When going uphill on a slope
answer4: ④ In a tunnel with heavy traffic

question: A driver needs to cross a sidewalk to enter a building. Which of the following describes the safest way to drive?
answer1: ① If there is no pedestrian on the sidewalk, proceed quickly.
answer2: ② Turn on the turn signal and enter immediately.
answer3: ③ Come to a temporary stop and check both sides, and cross the sidewalk in a manner that does not interfere with the flow of pedestrians.
answer4: ④ Honk your horn to let people know that you are crossing the sidewalk, and enter the parking lot quickly.

question: In which of the following situations is a two-wheeled vehicle allowed to cross a railway crossing?
answer1: ① The crossing gate of the railway crossing is closed.
answer2: ② The crossing gate of the railway crossing is about to close.
answer3: ③ The railway crossing has an alarm that is sounding.
answer4: ④ The signal indicates you can cross.

question: The driver of a two-wheeled vehicle must ( ) when an emergency vehicle approaches. Which answer fits in ( )?
answer1: ① Slow down
answer2: ② Yield the right of way
answer3: ③ Drive fast
answer4: ④ Stop immediately in the lane

question: If you have pulled over to the roadside and want to return to traffic, which of the following is the safest method to do so?
answer1: ① Move to the middle of the road without using the turn signal.
answer2: ② Switch on the turn signal to enter the road, and switch off the signal before you are done with changing lanes.
answer3: ③ Switch on the turn signal and enter the road slowly.
answer4: ④ Enter the road immediately after you switch on the turn signal.

question: Which of the following statements about road surface markings is correct?
answer1: ① A broken white line indicates that you can change directions.
answer2: ② A solid white line indicates that you can change directions when it is safe to do so.
answer3: ③ A broken yellow line (center line) indicates that you can change directions but cannot overtake.
answer4: ④ A solid yellow line (center line) restricts change of direction.

question: The following are different methods to signal when changing lanes. Which is the most appropriate?
answer1: ① If you change lanes without signaling, it is not a violation of traffic laws as long as it does not interfere with the movement of other vehicles.
answer2: ② Even after changing lanes, you should leave the signal on for some time to notify other drivers of your intent.
answer3: ③ Signal must be switched on only when changing lanes, and the signal should be switched off while a turn is being made.
answer4: ④ Signal must remain switched on until the change of lane is complete, and should be switched off immediately after changing lanes.

question: Which of the following explanations is correct?
answer1: ① White dotted lanes are meant to prohibit cutting in.
answer2: ② Lanes with solid white lines should be marked (installed) in sections of the road where changing lanes is acceptable.
answer3: ③ Lanes with solid white lines indicate bus-only lanes.
answer4: ④ Lanes with solid white lines are for restricting changes of course.

question: Which of the following describes the correct method of stopping a car on a road with a separate sidewalk for pedestrians?
answer1: ① Stop on the right edge of the roadway.
answer2: ② Stop on the sidewalk.
answer3: ③ Stop on the left edge of the roadway.
answer4: ④ Stop in a lane, in a convenient area.

question: The following statements are about yellow dotted lines on the edge of roads. Which is the most correct?
answer1: ① You can park or stop on the edge marked with yellow dotted lines.
answer2: ② Parking is prohibited on edges marked with yellow dotted lines, but you may stop.
answer3: ③ Parking is allowed on edges marked with yellow dotted lines, but you may not stop.
answer4: ④ Both parking and stopping are prohibited on edges marked with yellow dotted lines.

question: On which of the following roads can a two-wheeled vehicle make a U-turn?
answer1: ① A road with a solid yellow line in the center
answer2: ② A road with a solid white line in the center
answer3: ③ A road with a broken white line in the center
answer4: ④ A road with a solid blue line in the center

question: Which of the following is the most appropriate method to cross a railroad crossing?
answer1: ① Stop in front of the railroad crossing, make sure it is safe, and then cross.
answer2: ② If no train is passing, cross quickly.
answer3: ③ When the crossing gate begins to descend, cross quickly.
answer4: ④ Even if there is a traffic light, you must come to a stop before crossing.

question: Which of the following drivers best conform to traffic signals?
answer1: ① A driver who tailgates the vehicle in front of him/her.
answer2: ② A driver who drives according to the traffic signal on the other side of the road.
answer3: ③ A driver of a two-wheeled vehicle is not obliged to comply with the reversible lane signs.
answer4: ④ All drivers must obey the traffic signals.

question: If the signal at the traffic light before entering the intersection is yellow, which of the following is the most correct course of action?
answer1: ① Turn left while driving slowly.
answer2: ② Make a U-turn slowly.
answer3: ③ Increase the speed and quickly cross the stop line.
answer4: ④ Stop right before the stop line.

question: Which of the following statements related to taking a left turn at an intersection is good driving advice?
answer1: ① You need not worry about vehicles coming straight from the opposite direction.
answer2: ② You need to worry only about vehicles coming from the opposite direction and turning to their right.
answer3: ③ Check for vehicles moving in the same direction and turning to their right.
answer4: ④ Pay attention to vehicles moving in the same direction that are also taking a left turn.

question: Which of the following statements about the center line on a road is incorrect?
answer1: ① The purpose of the center line is to clarify the rules of vehicle and horse thoroughfare.
answer2: ② A solid yellow line or a broken yellow line can be used.
answer3: ③ A median strip or crash barrier can be installed.
answer4: ④ A center line cannot be installed on a reversible road for vehicles.

question: According to the Road Traffic Act and its Enforcement Decree, which of the following statements regarding a safe zone is not correct?
answer1: ① A safe zone is a section of the road marked with a safety sign for pedestrians crossing the road, or for the safety of vehicles moving in the area.
answer2: ② A safe zone is marked either in yellow or white.
answer3: ③ Safe zones are located in areas where there are obstacles.
answer4: ④ A safe zone is a section of the road marked with a safety sign for pedestrians crossing the road.

question: The driver of a two-wheeled vehicle driving on a reversible vehicle road sees a red X flashing over his/her lane. What is the safest method to drive?
answer1: ① Slow down and continue driving.
answer2: ② Stop temporarily, check for safety, and continue driving.
answer3: ③ Change quickly out of that lane.
answer4: ④ Change out of that lane momentarily and return to it later.

question: According to the Road Traffic Act and its Enforcement Decree, which of the following is NOT a category of traffic light?
answer1: ① Traffic lights for two-wheeled vehicles
answer2: ② Traffic lights for vehicles
answer3: ③ Traffic lights for bicycles
answer4: ④ Traffic lights for buses

question: Which of the following is NOT an offense for which the driver or the business owner may be fined if the act is proven by video recording?
answer1: ① Not adhering to protection of pedestrians
answer2: ② Violating rules of driving in an intersection
answer3: ③ Use of a bus-only lane
answer4: ④ Operating video display while driving

question: Which of the following best describes the cause and prevention of aquaplaning?
answer1: ① Controlling the steering wheel has a minimal impact during aquaplaning.
answer2: ② The newer the tires, the lower the chance of aquaplaning.
answer3: ③ The chance of aquaplaning rises as the contact area between the tires and as the road surface reduces.
answer4: ④ It is critical to maintaining vehicle speed when raining to prevent aquaplaning.

question: Which of the following is the most correct about the safe operation of two-wheeled vehicles?
answer1: ① One shall use the sidewalk when the road is blocked due to traffic congestion.
answer2: ② One shall maintain the same speed when passing speed bumps, and drive along the roadside area, where there are no speed bumps.
answer3: ③ One shall reduce the speed when it is raining.
answer4: ④ One can drive at a high speed on curved roads.

question: What is the safest method to respond to earthquakes?
answer1: ① If an earthquake occurs, drive quickly to get away from the location of the earthquake.
answer2: ② Make sure to allow enough distance from the car in front, and stop on the right side of the street.
answer3: ③ If you must evacuate from your car, keep your car’s engine on.
answer4: ④ Continue to proceed regardless of the earthquake.

question: When should a vehicle reduce its speed to 80% of the prescribed speed limit?
answer1: ① When visibility is less than 100 meters due to heavy snow or heavy rain
answer2: ② When the road surface is wet due to rain
answer3: ③ When the road surface is frozen due to snow
answer4: ④ When there is more than 20 mm of snow piled up on the road

question: Which of the following is the safest method to drive when passing through a foggy area where you can't see 70 meters ahead?
answer1: ① Turn on the headlights and quickly pass through the foggy area.
answer2: ② Turn on the headlights and emergency flashers and go slowly.
answer3: ③ Turn on the emergency flashers only and accelerate.
answer4: ④ Drive right behind the vehicle in front of you.

question: Which one of the following describes the best method to drive through a busy intersection without traffic lights?
answer1: ① Sound the horn and drive through quickly.
answer2: ② Turn on the emergency flashers, and drive through along the edge of the intersection.
answer3: ③ Since vehicles inside the intersection have the right of way, enter the intersection first.
answer4: ④ Before entering the intersection, stop momentarily and drive through while checking for safety.

question: A two-wheeled vehicle is following a cultivator on a road with a single lane in each direction, marked with solid yellow lines in the center. What is the safest method to drive?
answer1: ① Since the cultivator is a slow-moving vehicle, drive past quickly along its right.
answer2: ② Since a two-wheeled vehicle is faster than a cultivator, overtake it quickly across the center line.
answer3: ③ Sound the horn and drive along the center line.
answer4: ④ Maintain a safe following distance and follow the cultivator.

question: An exemplary driver explains a safe driving method to a novice driver. Which of the following is correct?
answer1: ① When passing through an intersection where there is no traffic control in busy traffic, it is advisable to pass slowly.
answer2: ② If the yellow light is on before you enter an intersection, you are allowed to pass.
answer3: ③ If there are solid white lines on the bridge, you may only focus on keeping the speed limit.
answer4: ④ You're not supposed to overtake a slow-moving vehicle following the instructions of police officials.

question: You are driving on a four-lane road and it’s raining. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is the safest way to drive in this situation? (Excluding when driving in residential, commercial, and industrial regions)
answer1: ① Because your free running distance shortens on rainy days, it is OK to drive at 70 kph.
answer2: ② Because your braking distance shortens on rainy days, it is OK to drive at a regular speed of 80 kph.
answer3: ③ Because it bears no relation to safe driving, it is OK to drive at 90 kph.
answer4: ④ You must reduce speed and drive at 60 kph.

question: You are driving on a four-lane road with an 80 kph speed limit covered with less than 10 mm of snow, and it's foggy, which limits visibility up to 50 m. Which of the following is the most proper way to drive?
answer1: ① Reduce speed by 20% from the speed limit.
answer2: ② Reduce speed by 30% from the speed limit.
answer3: ③ Reduce speed by 40% from the speed limit.
answer4: ④ Reduce speed by 50% from the speed limit.

question: Under the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is a correct explanation of changing course?
answer1: ① Since a bridge surface is a dangerous place, there are many cases where changing course is restricted by a solid white line.
answer2: ② Places that need to restrict changing course are marked with white dotted lanes.
answer3: ③ At places where changing course is prohibited, it should not be done even if it is difficult to pass due to obstacles coming from road construction, etc.
answer4: ④ If you change your course safely, it is not a violation of the law even if it is done in place where it is prohibited to change course.

question: Which is the most appropriate reason for using the engine brake when driving on a long downhill course?
answer1: ① To prevent the engine from overheating
answer2: ② To save fuel
answer3: ③ To prevent fading of the braking system
answer4: ④ To prevent reducing the vehicle’s lifetime

question: Which of the following is the safest way to drive in the area near the summit of a hill?
answer1: ① Keep close to the vehicle ahead of you and drive quickly.
answer2: ② Opposite lanes do not matter. Focus on your lane when driving over the hill.
answer3: ③ Because you cannot see the opposite lanes well, maintain caution when driving over the hill.
answer4: ④ Higher gear is better than lower gears.

question: Which of the following is the safest driving practice when driving on a road with sharp curves?
answer1: ① Turn the steering wheel quickly on a sharply curved road, reduce the speed by applying the brake, and proceed.
answer2: ② Reduce your speed sufficiently on a straight section of the road before entering the curved section.
answer3: ③ As a road with sharp curves is dangerous, you should accelerate to pass through quickly.
answer4: ④ If the road with sharp curves does not have a 'no passing' sign, pass the car in front of you quickly.

question: Which of the following is the best method to drive in a storm or a gust of wind?
answer1: ① Tightly hold onto the wheel with both hands and stay in your lane.
answer2: ② Accelerate regardless of the wind.
answer3: ③ Park near a sign, traffic light, or a tree.
answer4: ④ There is little danger of wind in mountainous areas, bridges, or near tunnels.

question: You are following a vehicle ahead on a roadway with a single lane in each direction, and are about to pass the highest point on a hill. What is the safest method to drive?
answer1: ① Since you cannot see ahead, stay close to the median strip and keep following the vehicle ahead.
answer2: ② Since you cannot see ahead or see the oncoming traffic, use caution and follow the vehicle ahead slowly.
answer3: ③ Since you cannot see what is going on ahead if you keep following the vehicle in front of you, overtake the vehicle quickly.
answer4: ④ Use the vehicle ahead as a shield, and drive closer to the vehicle.

question: Which of the following is the most proper way to drive through a four-lane tunnel?
answer1: ① Even though you are in the tunnel, the white broken line means you can change lanes.
answer2: ② Overtaking is not prohibited in tunnels. If the vehicle in front of you is too slow, you can overtake that vehicle.
answer3: ③ It is darker in tunnels, so tailgate the vehicle in front of you.
answer4: ④ If the vehicle in front of you is driving slowly and there are only a few vehicles in the tunnel, you can overtake.

question: According to the Road Traffic Act, the commissioner of a city or provincial police agency or the chief of a police station may, if deemed necessary, limit the speed of motor vehicles and horses to ( ) on a pedestrians-first road to ensure pedestrian safety. answer1: ① 20 km

answer2: ② 7 meters from the edge of an intersection
answer3: ③ 7 meters from the corner of the road
answer4: ④ 7 meters from a point where emergency fire extinguishing equipment is installed

question: Which of the following is correct regarding how to drive two-wheeled vehicles (excluding emergency vehicles)?
answer1: ① Drivers of two-wheeled vehicles may drive on a motor vehicle-only lane.
answer2: ② If a lane is sufficiently wide, two two-wheeled vehicles may drive side by side.
answer3: ③ Two-wheeled vehicles may drive in Lanes 2 and 3 on a general road with three lanes in each direction.
answer4: ④ If two-wheeled vehicles are driving as a group, they should form a queue to prevent other vehicles from cuttingin.

question: Which of the following is an administrative disposition of a driver's license if the driver of a motorcycle is arrested for retaliation?
answer1: ① 40 days of license suspension
answer2: ② 60 days of license suspension
answer3: ③ 100 days of license suspension
answer4: ④ Revocation of license

question: Which of the following describes a case in which the driver is prohibited from acquiring a driver's license for a certain period of time due to criminal charges of driving a motorcycle without a valid license?
answer1: ① When a fine penalty has been confirmed
answer2: ② When the offender has received a suspended indictment
answer3: ③ When the offender has received a suspended sentence
answer4: ④ When the offender has received protective disposition according to Article 32 of the Juvenile Act

question: Which of the following correctly describes a violation of the Road Traffic Act on the part of a two-wheeled vehicle driver, which is punishable by cancellation of her/his driver's license?
answer1: ① Operation of a two-wheeled motor vehicle with 0.07 percent of blood-alcohol concentration for the first time
answer2: ② Acquisition of a driver's license during a period in which the person is disqualified from acquiring a driver's license
answer3: ③ When arrested for criminal charges related to violent driving
answer4: ④ When the driver causes a traffic accident leading to material damages, and flees the scene of accident

question: Which of the following statements regarding the deduction of demerit points (Good Driving Mileage) for taking the No-offense/No-accident Pledge is correct?
answer1: ① The driver must take the No-offense/No-accident Pledge and comply with it for 2 years.
answer2: ② 10 reward points are given.
answer3: ③ If the license is about to be canceled due to the accumulation of demerit points, reward points are deducted from the cumulative points.
answer4: ④ If reward points are not used, they expire after 5 years.

question: What happens to the driver of a two-wheeled vehicle who is caught driving with a blood alcohol concentration of 0.11 off the road for the first time?
answer1: ① His/her driver’s license is canceled.
answer2: ② His/her driver’s license is suspended.
answer3: ③ He/she is not criminally punished.
answer4: ④ He/she is criminally punished.

question: Which of the following offenses by a driver of a motorcycle (excluding personal mobility devices) is subject to criminal punishment, even if it is not committed on a public road?
answer1: ① Driving without a license.
answer2: ② Driving under the influence of drugs
answer3: ③ Dangerous collective conduct
answer4: ④ Violent driving

question: The driver of a two-wheeled vehicle was criminally booked for drunk driving, and his or her driver’s license was canceled. In which of the following situations can the motorcyclist apply for cancellation of the administrative action concerning the driver’s license?
answer1: ① When under suspension of indictment
answer2: ② When under suspension of sentence
answer3: ③ When confirmed not guilty
answer4: ④ When under monetary penalty

question: Which of the following statements about submitting an objection to an administrative action concerning a driver’s license is INCORRECT?
answer1: ① The objection should be submitted within 60 days of receiving the administrative action.
answer2: ② The objection should be submitted to the commissioner of City/Do police agency in the jurisdiction.
answer3: ③ When the objection to the license cancellation is accepted, the action is converted to 100 demerit points.
answer4: ④ You may request an administrative trial independent of the objection.

question: According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following offenses by the driver of a two-wheeled vehicle does NOT result in 40 demerit points?
answer1: ① When criminally charged for aggressive driving
answer2: ② When criminally charged for dangerous collective behavior
answer3: ③ When violating a speed limit (over 40 km/h and up to 60 km/h)
answer4: ④ When not subjected to summary trial 60 days after the due date for payment of penalty

question: According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is not the correct punishment on the violation of laws by a driver of two-wheeled vehicle?
answer1: ① A KRW 20,000 penalty when not wearing personal protective gears such as helmet.
answer2: ② Up to 1 year of imprisonment or a fine of up to KRW 5 million in case of violent driving.
answer3: ③ A KRW 40,000 penalty when violating passage regulations such as passage on sidewalks.
answer4: ④ A KRW 20,000 penalty when using a mobile phone while driving.

question: The following are statements about speed limit violations caught on hidden cameras. Which of the following is correct?
answer1: ① Regardless of the type of vehicle or speed, the same fine or penalty will be imposed.
answer2: ② In addition to a fine, demerit points will be imposed.
answer3: ③ An additional penalty will be imposed if the violator is identified.
answer4: ④ If you do not pay the fine by the due date, additional charges of up to 75% may be levied.

question: The violation of which of the following speed limits (except for school zones) is subject to a special exception under the Act on Special Cases Concerning the Settlement of Traffic Accidents?
answer1: ① Exceeding 20 km/h
answer2: ② Exceeding 15 km/h
answer3: ③ Exceeding 10 km/h
answer4: ④ Exceeding 5 km/h

question: Which of the following traffic accidents is subject to the offense of dangerous driving resulting in injury or death under the Act on the Aggravated Punishment of Specific Crimes?
answer1: ① When a driver of a motorcycle injures a person while under the influence of drugs
answer2: ② When a cyclist under the influence of alcohol injures a person
answer3: ③ When the driver of an electric bicycle under the influence of alcohol injures a person
answer4: ④ When the driver of an electric bicycle under the influence of drugs injures a person

question: According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is NOT a correct prohibition related to personal mobility device?
answer1: ① Prohibition of use for children under the age of 13
answer2: ② Prohibition on passing through sidewalks and crosswalks
answer3: ③ Prohibition on driving at night
answer4: ④ Prohibition on driving under the influence of alcohol

question: When the driver of a two-wheeled vehicle creates noises that cause damage to others without a reasonable cause, which of the following describes a situation that is not punishable by the law?
answer1: ① Causing noise by abruptly starting the engine or by increasing the speed
answer2: ② Revving up the motor without delivering electric power to the wheel
answer3: ③ Sounding the horn repetitively or continuously
answer4: ④ Sounding the horn at a child who is jaywalking

question: According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is considered a dangerous behavior?
answer1: ① Reckless driving by two high school students on a two-wheeled vehicle
answer2: ② Speeding by an automobile
answer3: ③ Three cars and a two-wheeled vehicle obstructing traffic
answer4: ④ Dozens of two-wheeled vehicles parked in a parking lot

question: A vehicle fails to stop temporarily in front of a railroad crossing and collides with a train, causing an accident involving human injury. In this case, which of the following statements about the punishments that will be imposed on the driver is correct?
answer1: ① The driver will not receive criminal punishment if he/she has comprehensive automobile insurance or reaches an agreement with the victim regarding compensation.
answer2: ② According to the Road Traffic Act, the driver will only receive an administrative punishment for violating the prescribed method of passing a railroad crossing.
answer3: ③ The driver will be subject to criminal punishment for causing an accident involving human injury through violating the prescribed method of passing a railroad crossing.
answer4: ④ The Road Traffic Act and the Act on Special Cases Concerning the Settlement of Traffic Accidents do not apply to accidents occurring at a railroad crossing.

question: Which of the following is a traffic accident caused by speed violation that can be prosecuted against the stated intention of the victim under the Act on Special Cases Concerning the Settlement of Traffic Accidents? (Excluding school zones)
answer1: ① In case of an accident resulting in personal injury caused by exceeding the speed limit of the relevant road by 5km/h
answer2: ② In case of an accident resulting in personal injury caused by exceeding the speed limit of the relevant road by 10km/h
answer3: ③ In case of an accident resulting in personal injury caused by exceeding the speed limit of the relevant road by 15km/h
answer4: ④ In case of an accident resulting in personal injury caused by exceeding the speed limit of the relevant road by 20km/h

question: Which of the following is subject to the “Prohibition of Reckless Driving” under the Road Traffic Act?
answer1: ① Personal mobility device
answer2: ② A two-wheeled vehicle
answer3: ③ Electronic bicycle
answer4: ④ Bicycle

question: According to the Road Traffic Act and its Enforcement Decree, which of the following is NOT correct for vehicles, etc. (excluding personal mobility devices) regarding speed limit?
answer1: ① The maximum speed of motor vehicle-only lane is 90 km/h.
answer2: ② The maximum speed in an expressway with one lane in each direction is 80 km/h.
answer3: ③ The speed in the general road of residential areas, commercial areas and industrial areas is within 70 km/h.
answer4: ④ The speed of school zones is within 30 km/h.

question: Which of the following is the penalty that you would incur for hitting an elementary student crossing a crosswalk without pedestrian signals, causing a minor injury?
answer1: ① You will be subject to criminal prosecution according to the Act on Special Cases Concerning the Settlement of Traffic Accidents.
answer2: ② You will not be subject to criminal prosecution if you have comprehensive insurance.
answer3: ③ Since the victim is a minor, you just need to contact his/her parents.
answer4: ④ There's no need for you to give your contact details to the victim.

question: Which of the following is NOT correct regarding the traffic standards by lane under the Road Traffic Act?
answer1: ① The type of lane to be used by cars is determined by dividing the road into an expressway, a automobile road, and other roads that have two or more lanes.
answer2: ② On roads other than expressways, two-wheeled vehicles must travel in the right lane.
answer3: ③ On the expressway, trucks must travel in the right lane.
answer4: ④ Motorcycles must travel in the right lane to turn left at an intersection with two left-turn lanes.

question: According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is not considered an automobile?
answer1: ① A truck
answer2: ② A special-purpose vehicle
answer3: ③ A two-wheeled vehicle
answer4: ④ A motorcycle

question: According to the Road Traffic Act and its Enforcement Decree, which of the following is the correct amount of penalty imposed on a person who refused to take breathalyzer test after being caught riding a bicycle under the influence of alcohol by a police officer?
answer2: ② KRW 50,000
answer3: ③ KRW 30,000
answer4: ④ There is no penalty.

question: According to the Road Traffic Act, which one of the following is NOT authorized to give signals or instructions to drivers?
answer1: ① Auxiliary Police Officer
answer2: ② Persons designated as Best Drivers
answer3: ③ Crossing guards
answer4: ④ Firefighters guiding firefighting vehicles responding to an emergency

question: Which of the following is NOT a correct way to use an intersection when the traffic light is yellow?
answer1: ① Stop before the stop line.
answer2: ② If you are already in the intersection, drive quickly out of the intersection.
answer3: ③ You may turn right as long as you are not interfering with the traffic.
answer4: ④ It is a violation of the rules to pass through the intersection even if you proceed after you are already in the intersection.

question: In which of the following situations should a two-wheeled vehicle NOT drive along the center or left side of the road?
answer1: ① On a one-way road
answer2: ② When right turns are not allowed due to road works
answer3: ③ When traffic is congested

question: Which of the following is NOT a correct way to drive a two-wheeled vehicle in a place where there is a clear distinction between the roadway and sidewalk?

answer2: ② You can cross the sidewalk on your two-wheeled vehicle to enter or exit areas outside the road.
answer3: ③ You can drive your two-wheeled vehicle on the sidewalk to deliver mail.
answer4: ④ Even a senior citizen driving a two-wheeled vehicle is not allowed to drive on the sidewalk.

question: Which of the following statements about driving in the bus-only lane of a general roadway is INCORRECT?
answer1: ① A 36-seater or larger passenger vehicle may use the bus-only lane.
answer2: ② All vehicles may use the bus-only lane if all lanes other than the bus-only lane are damaged.

answer4: ④ A taxi may use the bus-only lane briefly if the customers want to get out of the taxi.

question: According to the Road Traffic Act, the term 'dangerous collective conduct' describes an action by ( ) or more people driving two or more vehicles (excluding personal mobility devices) together on the road and causing risk to others without any legitimate reason. Which of the following fits in ( )?
answer1: ① 1
answer2: ② 2
answer3: ③ 3
answer4: ④ 4

question: Which of the following statements is NOT correct regarding a lane change by two-wheeled vehicles?
answer1: ① Change lanes safely at a section marked by dotted white lines.
answer2: ② You may change lanes over solid white lines as long as you are not interfering with the traffic.
answer3: ③ Use a turn signal to show the direction in which you wish to change lanes.

question: According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is NOT a situation in which you should slow down to 50% of the speed limit?
answer1: ① The road is wet due to rain.
answer2: ② The road is icy.
answer3: ③ Your visibility is limited to 100 meters due to fog, etc.
answer4: ④ The road is covered with 20 millimeters or more of snow.

question: Which one of the following ways of overtaking another vehicle is correct?
answer1: ① Overtake by going to the left side of the vehicle ahead.

question: Which of the following is the correct way of yielding at an intersection without traffic control?
answer1: ① If there are vehicles attempting to enter the intersection at the same time, the vehicle to the right must give way to the vehicle on the left.
answer2: ② A vehicle that enters the intersection after other vehicles must give way to the vehicles that have already entered the intersection.

answer4: ④ A vehicle entering from a wider road must give way to the vehicle entering from a narrow road.

question: According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following lights should be turned on if a driver of a Motorcycle is driving on foggy road?
answer1: ① Side light and number plate light
answer2: ② Side light and tail light
answer3: ③ Head light and tail light

question: Which of the following statements about the lights of two-wheeled vehicles is NOT correct?
answer1: ① When there is oncoming traffic, lower the headlights.

question: According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is NOT correct regarding regulations that prohibit dangerous group behaviors? (excluding personal mobility devices)

question: Which of the following statements is correct regarding regulations that prohibit driving when fatigued (including drowsy driving)?

question: A police officer is allowed to remove an illegal fitting from a two-wheeled vehicle for safety. Which one of the following is NOT allowed to be removed?

answer2: ② Wide tires that fail to meet the standards
answer3: ③ A radio communication device with the same frequency as the police radio
answer4: ④ Flashing lights, siren, or emergency lights fitted to non-emergency vehicles

question: Which of the following situations does NOT result in criminal penalties with regards to the driver of a two-wheeled vehicle with comprehensive insurance under the Act on Special Cases Concerning the Settlement of Traffic Accidents?
answer1: ① The driver of a two-wheeled vehicle crosses the center line and crashes into an oncoming car, resulting in an injury requiring 2 weeks of medical treatment.

answer3: ③ The driver of a two-wheeled vehicle hits a senior citizen walking in an alleyway, resulting in an injury requiring 3weeks of medical treatment.
answer4: ④ The driver of a two-wheeled vehicle hits a pedestrian on a crosswalk (no traffic lights for pedestrians), resulting in an injury requiring 3 weeks of medical treatment.

question: Which one of the following is NOT the correct method for the driver of a two-wheeled vehicle to respond to a traffic accident?

question: Which of the following is an administrative disposition regarding a driver's license if the driver of a motorcycle is criminally charged for dangerous group behavior?
answer1: ① 40 days of license suspension
answer2: ② 60 days of license suspension
answer3: ③ 100 days of license suspension
answer4: ④ Revocation of license

question: What happens when the driver of a two-wheeled vehicle abruptly stops in front of a passenger car due to road rage?

answer2: ② Pursuant to the Criminal Code, a charge of special threat will be applied, and the driver will be criminally booked.
answer3: ③ If criminally booked, the driver will receive 40 demerit points.
answer4: ④ If jailed, the driver will receive 100 demerit points.

question: According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is NOT correct regarding the regulations against aggressive driving? (excluding personal mobility devices)
answer1: ① The regulations apply only to automobile drivers and motorcyclists.
answer2: ② The regulations apply when two or more legal offenses (or a single legal offense) are continued and repeated.
answer3: ③ The regulations apply when a driver/passenger is threatened or harmed, or a traffic-related risk is present.

question: Which of the following statements about the requirements related to drivers of two-wheeled vehicles wearing a safety helmet is NOT correct?
answer1: ① A two-wheeled vehicle driver who does not wear a safety helmet will be imposed a fine of KRW 20,000.

question: According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is NOT correct regarding the regulations that prohibit drunk driving?

answer4: ④ A driver who has consumed alcoholic beverages will be criminally punished if his or her blood alcohol concentration is 0.02% or higher.

question: According to the Toll Road Act, which of the following is NOT a reason for imposing 10 times higher than the discounted toll fee?

answer3: ③ When receiving a discount by showing the certificate subject to toll fee exemption held by other person.
answer4: ④ When passing through a Hi-pass lane without a Hi-pass device.

question: Which of the following is not a correct description of the U-turn method?
answer1: ① If you make a U-turn while interfering with other vehicles in progress at the U-turn point, it is a violation of rules governing the U-turn.
answer2: ② If there is no auxiliary sign and only a U-turn sign is present, you can make a U-turn regardless of the signal as long as you do not interfere with other traffic.

question: Which of the following statements regarding two-wheeled motor vehicles using a pedestrian sidewalk is NOT correct?

question: Which of the following statements regarding drivers of two-wheeled vehicles using an intersection is NOT correct?
answer1: ① To turn right on your two-wheeled vehicle, slow down and drive along the edge on the right side of the road.
answer2: ② To turn left on your two-wheeled vehicle, turn along the inner side on the intersection's center.
answer3: ③ Do not enter the intersection if you see traffic congestion and think your entry could interfere with the traffic.

question: According to the Road Traffic Act and its Enforcement Decree, which of the following is considered a ‘motor vehicle’?

question: According to the Promotion of the Use of Bicycles Act, which of the following is not a bicycle lane?
answer1: ① Bicycle-only lane

question: According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is not a PMD?
answer1: ① Electric kick scooters

question: The driver of a two-wheeled vehicle detects a cyclist traveling ahead on a curve. What is the safest method for the motorcyclist to drive?

question: According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is considered a motor vehicle or horse? (Under the width of 1 m)
answer1: ① A rollator
answer2: ② A bicycle used by a senior person
answer3: ③ A handcart (not motorized)

question: Which lane should bicycles use on a general road with three lanes in each direction??
answer1: ① First lane
answer2: ② Second Lane
answer3: ③ Third lane
answer4: ④ Any lane

question: Which of the following is not true about the criteria and operation of PMDs?

question: Which of the following is the correct pair of vehicles that can use a bicycle crossing?

question: Which of the following is a good method to increase your two-wheeled vehicle’s fuel efficiency?

answer2: ② Maintaining an economic speed
answer3: ③ Departing swiftly without delay

question: Which of the following is a good approach to eco-friendly and fuel-efficient driving?

answer2: ② Accelerate and turn abruptly.
answer3: ③ A two-wheeled vehicle needs to be inspected only when parts are being replaced.

answer2: ② Using adulterated petrol can reduce your fuel costs.

question: Which of the following is NOT an environmentally conscious driver?

answer2: ② A driver who maintains a constant speed and does not accelerate abruptly

question: What is the term used for the speed at which fuel savings are the greatest?

answer2: ② Maximum speed

question: What is the best method to increase the fuel efficiency of an automobile?

answer2: ② Fill up the fuel tank as often as you can.

question: Which of the following drivers is the best at enhancing fuel efficiency?
answer1: ① A driver who always starts abruptly
answer2: ② A driver who maintains a constant speed
